form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Banks introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To repeal the Portable Fuel Container Safety Act of 2020 and the Children’s Gasoline Burn Prevention Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Gas Can Freedom Act of 2025.

subsection.header: Portable Fuel Container Safety Act of 2020
subsection.text: The Portable Fuel Container Safety Act of 2020 (15 U.S.C. 2056d) is repealed.
The Children’s Gasoline Burn Prevention Act (15 U.S.C. 2056 note) is repealed.

paragraph.text: A regulation promulgated by the Consumer Product Safety Commission pursuant to an Act repealed by subsection (a) or (b) shall have no force or effect.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Consumer Product Safety Commission may not promulgate any regulation that requires—

subparagraph.text: a flame mitigation device in a portable fuel container; or
a portable gasoline container to conform to child-resistant requirements.
